uri.LocalizedString: Warning: UBmatrix Processing Engine detected a UBmatrix propriety formula linkbase language syntax. The UBmatrix Taxonomy Designer product implemented proprietary a formula language syntax before the XBRL.org specification working group wrote and published the XBRL Formula Linkbase 1.0 specification. UBmatrix Processing Engine currently only supports executing the XBRL Formula Linkbase 1.0 language syntax. There are a number of published XBRL taxonomies that use the UBmatrix proprietary formula language syntax. When loading these taxonomies with Processing Engine, the formulae will not execute. Processing Engine will load the propriety formula linkbases as “custom” linkbases that contain links, locators, arcs, and resources that can be validated, rendered, and edited using standard XBRL 2.1 semantics. Processing Engine may support UBmatrix formulae in future releases.

uri.LocalizedString: Error in "{0}." The "unitRef" attribute MUST NOT occur in non-numeric items. In the XML Schema for XBRL instances, item is defined as an abstract element. This means that it will never appear in its own right in an XBRL instance. Therefore, all elements representing single facts or business measurements defined in an XBRL taxonomy document and reported in an XBRL instance MUST be either (a) members of the substitution group item; or, (b) members of a substitution group originally based on item. XBRL taxonomies include taxonomy schemas that contain such element definitions. item elements might need to be referenced from elsewhere (such as from a footnote) therefore taxonomy authors SHOULD NOT prohibit the id attribute inherited from the base XBRL item type.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 4.6 of the XBRL 2.1 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Error in "{0}." Numeric items MUST include a "unitRef" attribute referencing a unit element in the same XBRL instance In the XML Schema for XBRL instances, item is defined as an abstract element. This means that it will never appear in its own right in an XBRL instance. Therefore, all elements representing single facts or business measurements defined in an XBRL taxonomy document and reported in an XBRL instance MUST be either (a) members of the substitution group item; or, (b) members of a substitution group originally based on item. XBRL taxonomies include taxonomy schemas that contain such element definitions. item elements might need to be referenced from elsewhere (such as from a footnote) therefore taxonomy authors SHOULD NOT prohibit the id attribute inherited from the base XBRL item type. .

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 4.6 of the XBRL 2.1 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Error in "{0}." This is an invalid relationship end point. A tuple MUST NOT have a context. item elements MUST NOT be descendants of other item elements. Structural relationships necessary in an XBRL instance MUST be captured only using tuples. The intellectual structure ? the relationship of financial concepts to each other in a variety of senses ? is captured by the link structure of taxonomy linkbases rather than by nesting of facts in XBRL instances.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 4.6 of the XBRL 2.1 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Error in "{0}." Numeric items MUST have a statement of the units of measurement. The unit element specifies the units in which a numeric item has been measured. The content of the unit element MUST be either a simple unit of measure expressed with a single measure element or a ratio of products of units of measure, with the ratio represented by the divide element and the numerator and denominator products both represented by a sequence of measure elements.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 4.8 of the XBRL 2.1 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Error in "{0}." All tuples and all non-numeric items MUST NOT have a statement of the units of measurement. Numeric items identify their units using the unitRef attribute. The unitRef attribute is used to identify the unit element that is associated with the item on which the unitRef attribute occurs. The value of the unitRef attribute MUST be equal to the value of an id attribute on a unit element in the XBRL instance that contains the numeric item on which the unitRef attribute occurs.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 4.6.2 .of the XBRL 2.1 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Error in "{0}." A numeric item MUST NOT have a "precision" attribute and a "decimals" attribute. Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 4.6.3 of the XBRL 2.1 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The hypercube "{0}" is not abstract. The hypercube element MUST be abstract.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.2 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The source of the hypercube-dimension arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The source of a hypercube-dimension relationship MUST be a hypercube declaration.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The target of the hypercube-dimension arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The target of a hypercube-dimension relationship MUST be a dimension declaration.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error:The source of the all, notAll arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The source of an "all" or "notAll" relationship must be a primary item declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.3.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error:The target of the all, notAll arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The target of an "all" or "notAll" relationship must be a hypercube declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.3.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The all, notAll arc "{0}" does not have an xbrldt:contextElement attribute. A has-hypercube arc MUST have an xbrldt:contextElement attribute.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.3.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: "{0}" contains a cycle. Within a Dimensional Relationship Set there must not be directed cycles not allowed by the arc declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.4.3 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: "{0}" is not abstract. Dimension elements MUST be abstract

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The xbrldt:typedDomainRef attribute appears on an element declaration "{0}" that is not a dimension declaration. The referenced file is not in the DTS or the file does not contain an element identified by the XPointer expression.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.2.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The xbrldt:typedDomainRef attribute of "{0}" does not locate a typed dimension. The xbrldt:typedDomainRef attribute MUST not locate any of the following: Nothing, something that is not a global XML Schema element declaration, or a global abstract element declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.2.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The dimension "{0}" has an xbrldt:typedDomainRef attribute that contains an invalid URI or does not contain a fragment identifier.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.2.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The dimension of the dimension-domain arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The source of a dimension-domain arc MUST be an explicit dimension declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.3.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error:The target of the dimension-domain arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The target of a dimension-domain arc MUST be a domain member declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.3.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: A cycle exist, the primary item "{0}" cannot be a member of the domain of any of its dimensions. There MUST not exist a cycle in which the primary item source of the hypercube is also a member of a domain of any of the declared explicit dimensions.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.3.2.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The target of the domain-member arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The source of a domain-member relationship MUST be a primary item declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.3.2.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The target of the domain-member arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The target of a domain-member relationship must be a primary item declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.5.3.2.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The dimensional element "{0}" does not have a standard label in any language. There MUST be at least one standard label of a dimensional element in the schema-rooted DTS of the schema where the element is defined.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.7.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The source of the dimension-default arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The source of a dimension-default arc MUST be an explicit dimension declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.8.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The target of the dimension-default arc "{0}" is not the correct type. The target of a dimension-default arc MUST be domain member declaration.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.8.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The dimension "{0}" has too many default members declared. There MUST be no more than one default member in a domain.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.8.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: The primary item instance "{0}" is not dimensionally valid in context "{1}"({2}). See other errors for reasons why "{0}" is not dimensionally valid. A primary item is dimensionally valid in the hypercubes found in at least one base set are mutually valid.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 3.1.1 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: In the context "{0}" ({1}), the reported element "{3}" of dimension "{2}" causes a repeated dimension to appear in the instance document. A context MUST NOT contain more than one dimension value for each dimension.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 3.1.4.2 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: In the context "{0}" ({1}), the reported element "{3}" is a default value of the dimension "{2}". The default value of a dimension MUST NOT be reported in an instance.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 2.8.1.2 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: In the context "{0}" ({1}), the reported element "{3}" refers to "{2}" which is not a typed dimension. The content of the dimension attribute of an xbrldi:typedMember element MUST be the QName of a typed dimension declaration defined in a schema within the DTS of the instance document.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 3.1.4.4.2 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: In the context "{0}" ({1}), the reported element "{3}" refers to "{2}" which is not an explicit dimension. The content of the dimension attribute of an xbrldi:explicitMember element MUST be the QName of an explicit dimension element defined in a schema within the DTS of the instance document.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 3.1.4.5.2 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.

uri.LocalizedString: Dimensions Validation Error: In the context "{0}" ({1}), the QName value "{3}" of the explicit dimension "{2}" is not an element defined in the taxonomy schema. The content of the xbrldi:explicitMember element must be a QName whose global element definition can be found in the taxonomy schema referenced by the namespace of the QName.

Reference.Text: For more information, please see section 3.1.4.5.3 of the Dimensions 1.0 recommendation.
